CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 20, 1962, pg. 6, reads: "At '32' Rally - in Syria Mosque on Monday night, an overflow crowd of more than 2,000 ward leaders, committeemen, committeewomen and friends. Under the guidance of Joseph Durzo, the meeting was one fo the most enthusiastic in years.  Shown above are (left to right) Maurice Goldstein, candidate for re-election to the State Assembly; Mrs. Mary Scranton; Congressman William W. Scranton, Republican candidate for Governor; W. P. Young, who spoke at the rally; County Chairman Paul Hugus (at microphone) and Congressman James E. Van Zandt, Republican candidate for U.S. Senator. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Paul Hugus at podium with microphone, in front of Maurice Goldstein, Mary Scranton, Congressman William "Bill" Scranton, W. P. Young, and Congressman James E. Van Zandt, at "32 Club" Republican rally, Syria Mosque
